attributes.action: To not prevent President Donald Trump from making a State Visit to the U.K..
attributes.additional_details: The new U.S. President’s governance is still developing and needs time to do so. It is not the place of unsuccessful “remainers” to now focus on undermining the prospects of the U.K. and U.S. relationship. The likes of Tim Farron, Nick Clegg, Jeremy Corbyn, Diane Abbott, and the BBC’s Laura Kuenssberg risk the potential economic benefits of a bi-lateral trade agreement for the sake of their own selfish, myopic, beliefs. These people are all paid by the public but have no regard for the public.
attributes.background: This is a counter to the other petition. It will be far more embarrassing to Her Majesty to withdraw an invitation already proffered. President Trump’s Executive orders are the business of the U.S. Government and any issues should be discussed between them and the U.K. Government.
